messages.subject: From the list owner
messages.msgSnippet: Today s mail has been heavier than any week before this.  I dont want to loser readers over the volume, but it was a pretty interesting day. By private e-mail
messages.messageBody:
Today's mail has been heavier than any week before this. I dont want to
loser readers over the volume, but it was a pretty interesting day.

By private e-mail I receive this (and some more I'm not going to quote):

-=-I really don't have to defend all of my statements that are tangential to
the thread. -=-

I will ask that people not post anything on this list that they're not
willing to defend.

We have enough to think about in the world with what is factual, or true
experience of someone or another, without things that nobody's willing to
defend.

So yes, on my list people really do have to defend their statements, or back
off making them. Because I don't want to lose readers just because one or
two or three people want to make unfounded assertions.

I don't know how many yahoo lists there are, but I bet there are 20 just on
unschooling and eclectic. There are other places to go.

Sandra
